bn.inference

Class LikelihoodWeightingInferencer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bn.inference.LikelihoodWeightingInferencer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Inferencer

    public class LikelihoodWeightingInferencer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Inferencer
    Implements the likelihood weighting algorithm for approximate inference in Bayesian networks described in AIMA Figure 14.15.

    • Constructor Summary

      Distribution query(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork network)
      Return an estimate of the Distribution P(X|e) from the given BayesianNetwork, using the default number of samples.
      Distribution query(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork network, int n)
      Return an estimate of the Distribution P(X|e) from the given BayesianNetwork, where X is the query RandomVariable, e is an Assignment representing the evidence variables and their values, and n is the total number of samples to be generated.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Test LikelihoodWeightingInferencer.

        Usage: 

             java LikelihoodWeightingInferencer N FILE QVAR [EVAR EVAL]*
        The arguments are as follows: first, the number of samples to use; second, the XMLBIF file defining the Bayesian Network; third the name of the query variable; and following that the evidence variables and their values (assumed to be Strings) in pairs.

        The example from AIMA 14.4.1 would be run as: 

                       java -cp bin bn.inference.LikelihoodWeightingInferencer 100000 src/bn/examples/aima-alarm.xml B J true M true
        True distribution is approx. <0.284,0.716>.

        The example from AIMA 14.5.1 (Figure 14.12a) would be run as: 

                       java -cp bin bn.inference.LikelihoodWeightingInferencer 100000 src/bn/examples/aima-wet-grass.xml R S true
        True distribution is <0.3,0.7>.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
